relation: the organisation to match as a regexp
the module name to match as a regexp
the revision to match as a regexp
textBeforeTable: Attributes since 1.3 The optional override attribute enables you to avoid overriding the previous value of the variable, which makes the definition behave like an ant property, which is particularly useful to define default values (values which are used only if they haven't been defined yet). Defines an ivy variable. Tag: property property 0..1 defines the list of available statuses statuses 0..1 defines the list of available report outputters outputters 0..1 defines rules between modules and dependency resolvers modules 0..1 defines conflicts managers conflict-managers 0..1 defines dependency resolvers resolvers 0..n defines a new macro resolver macrodef 0..1 defines new namespaces namespaces 0..1 register triggers on ivy events triggers 0..1 defines new version matchers version-matchers 0..1 defines module descriptor parsers parsers 0..1 defines latest strategies latest-strategies 0..1 defines repository cache managers caches 0..1 defines lock strategies lock-strategies 0..n defines new types in ivy typedef 0..n add a location in the classpath used to load plugins classpath 0..n includes another settings file include 0..1 configures ivy with some defaults settings 0..n loads a properties file as ivy
textAfterTable: Examples  <property name="myvar" value="myvalue"/> Sets the variable myvar to the value myvalue.  <property name="myvar" value="myvalue" override="false"/> Sets the variable myvar to the value myvalue only if myvar has not been set yet. properties Tag: properties Loads a properties file into ivy variables. See the variables chapter above for details about ivy variables. Since 2.0: it is possible to access environment variables. This can be done by specifying the environment attribute. This attribute specifies the prefix which can be used to access these environment variables. For instance, if you specify environment="env", you can access the PATH environment variable with the env.PATH property name. Attributes Attribute Description Required file a path to a properties file to load One of these environment the prefix to use when retrieving environment variables (since 2.0) override indicates if the variable found in the properties file should override its previous value, if any (since 1.3) No, defaults to true settings Tag: settings Configures some important ivy info: default resolver, latest strategy, conflict
